title: Remove duplicate upper footer section, keep only the Document Master Tools footer

requirements.text: Update frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx to remove the first (upper) footer section entirely, keeping only the lower footer section that begins with 'Document Master Tools'. The final footer must be a single section. Do not modify any footer styling, alignment, links, copyright text, external link settings, or mobile responsiveness. No other layout changes.

quotes: Remove the FIRST (upper) footer section completely.
Keep ONLY the SECOND (lower) footer section that starts with: "Document Master Tools"
The final website must have only ONE footer section.
Do NOT modify: Footer styling, Footer alignment, Links, Copyright text, External link settings, Mobile responsiveness

acceptanceCriteria: The website renders exactly one footer section site-wide.
The retained footer section starts with 'Document Master Tools' branding.
The removed section (containing Quick Links, Legal, About, copyright, and 'Built with ❤️ using caffeine.ai') is no longer rendered anywhere.
All links, copyright text (© 2026 RJY TOTAL MANPOWERS SERVICES PRIVATE LIMITED. All Rights Reserved.), and external link attributes (target, rel) in the remaining footer section are unchanged.
Footer styling (colors, typography, spacing, padding) is identical to the pre-change state.
Footer is fully mobile responsive and displays correctly at 320px width and above.
No other components or layout sections are affected by this change.

constraints: Do not modify footer styling, colors, typography, or spacing.
Do not modify any links, href values, or external link attributes (target='_blank', rel='noopener noreferrer').
Do not modify the copyright text: © 2026 RJY TOTAL MANPOWERS SERVICES PRIVATE LIMITED. All Rights Reserved.
Do not alter mobile responsiveness or layout of the retained footer section.
No changes to any component other than Footer.tsx.
nonGoals: Adding new links or sections to the footer.
Modifying the Header or any other layout component.
Altering any page routing or content outside the footer.
